intro: Catha grossulariae, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, green, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical significance in traditional medicine. However, it is not related to the coffee plant (Coffea spp.) despite its common name.
